text: Daniella Velloso Borges Ribeiro (born 26 March 1972) is a federal senator of Brazil representing her home state of Paraíba. She was previously served in the Legislative Assembly of Paraíba from 2011 to 2019 and was vereador of Campina Grande from 2009 to 2011. ==Personal life== Ribeiro was born to Enivaldo Ribeiro and Virgínia Velloso Borges. Her father Enivaldo is also a politician who served as mayor of Capina Grande from 1977 to 1983, while her brother Aguinaldo served as minister of cities from 2012 to 2014. She is divorced and has three children: Lucas, Marcella, and Gabriel. She has degrees from the Federal University of Paraíba and the University of Brasília. ==Political career== In the 2008 election Ribeiro was elected to the city hall with 6,838 votes. Ribeiro was elected to the legislative assembly of the state of Paraíba in 2010 with 29,863 votes. Along with Veneziano Vital do Rêgo, Ribeiro was elected to the federal senate from the state of Paraíba in the 2018 Brazilian general election. ==References== Category:1972 births Category:Living people Category:People from Campina Grande Category:University of Brasília alumni Category:Progressistas politicians Category:Members of the Federal Senate Category:Members of the Legislative Assembly of Paraíba Category:Brazilian women in politics
title: Daniella Ribeiro
